# Privacy-Enhanced Mail

The challenge gives us a .pem file

```
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

nh6tZ+tVQCRvFviIEGkaXdEiBN4eTbcjfc5md/u9eA5N21Pzgd/G
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

```

We have to extract the private key d as a decimal integer from this PEM-formatted RSA key.

It recommends using `PyCryptodome` module, we can read the key data using `RSA.importKey()` 

```py
from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA

f = open('privacy_enhanced_mail_1f696c053d76a78c2c531bb013a92d4a.pem','r')
a = RSA.importKey(f.read())
```

The `RSA.importKey()` return an `RsaKey` object. The private key is the `d` properties of `RsaKey`

```py
print(a.d)
```

Result

>
